children.text:
Now, writing the Fortran code step by step. The code structure:

program main

    implicit none

    character(len=1000) :: initial_str
    integer :: K
    character(len=2), dimension(:), allocatable :: inputs
    integer :: res, i, j, a, b, c1, c2, len_initial, a1, a2, min_val, newNumber, pow, temp_val, r, digit
    character(len=20) :: str2
    character(len=20) :: a_str, b_str

    !
children.label: high_level_plan

children.text:
Allocate array for inputs
    allocate(inputs(K))

    ! Read K lines each with two characters
    do i =1, K
        read(*,'(A2)') inputs(i)
    end do

    ! Compute res
    res =0

    do i=1, K
        ! Get the two characters from current input
        c1 = ichar(inputs(i)(1:1))
        c2 = ichar(inputs(i)(2:2))

        a =0
        b =0

        do j=1, len_initial
            ! Current character in initial_str
            character(len=1) :: current_char = initial_str(j:j)
            integer :: current_code = ichar(current_char)

            if (current_code == c1) then
                a = a +1
            else if (current_code == c2) then
                b = b +1
            else
                res = res + min(a, b)
                a =0
                b =0
            end if
        end do

        res = res + min(a, b)
    end do

    ! Convert res to string for second program
    write(str2, '(I0)') res
    str2 = adjustl(str2)  !
children.label: code_analysis

children.text:
Remove leading spaces
    integer :: len_str2 = len_trim(str2)

    ! Process second program's logic
    a1 =0
    a2 =0

    ! Process a_str
    a_str = str2
    do i=2, len_str2
        if (a_str(i:i) == a_str(i-1:i-1)) then
            if (a_str(i:i) == '1') then
                a_str(i:i) = '0'
            else
                a_str(i: i) = '1'
            end if
            a1 = a1 +1
        end if
    end do

    ! Process b_str
    b_str = str2 do i = len_str2, 2, -1 if (b_str(i:i) == b_str(i-1:i-1)) then
            if (b_str(i-1:i-1) == '1') then
                b_str(i-1:i-1) = '0'
            else
                b_str(i-1:i-1) = '1'
            end if
            a2 = a2 +1
        end if
    end do

    min_val = min(a1, a2)

    ! Process third program's logic
    newNumber =0
    pow =0
    temp_val = min_val

    do while (temp_val >0) r = mod(temp_val,10)
        temp_val = temp_val /10 if (9 - r < r) then
            if ( (temp_val ==0) .and. (9 - r ==0) ) then
                digit = r
            else
                digit = 9 - r
            end if
        else
            digit = r
        end if
        newNumber = newNumber + digit * 10**pow
        pow = pow +1
    end do

    !
children.label: code_analysis

program main

    implicit none

    character(len=1000) :: initial_str
    integer :: K
    character(len=2), dimension(:), allocatable :: inputs
    integer :: res, i, j, a, b, c1, c2, len_initial, a1, a2, min_val, newNumber, pow, temp_val, r, digit
    character(len=20) :: str2
    character(len=20) :: a_str, b_str

    ! Read first input: initial string
    read(*,'(A)') initial_str
    len_initial = len_trim(initial_str)

    ! Read K
    read(*,*) K

    ! Allocate array for inputs
    allocate(inputs(K))

    ! Read K lines each with two characters
    do i =1, K
        read(*,'(A2)') inputs(i)
    end do

    ! Compute res
    res =0

    do i=1, K
        ! Get the two characters from current input
        c1 = ichar(inputs(i)(1:1))
        c2 = ichar(inputs(i)(2:2))

        a =0
        b =0

        do j=1, len_initial
            ! Current character in initial_str
            character(len=1) :: current_char = initial_str(j:j)
            integer :: current_code = ichar(current_char)

            if (current_code == c1) then
                a = a +1
            else if (current_code == c2) then
                b = b +1
            else
                res = res + min(a, b)
                a =0
                b =0
            end if
        end do

        res = res + min(a, b)
    end do

    ! Convert res to string for second program
    write(str2, '(I0)') res
    str2 = adjustl(str2)  ! Remove leading spaces
    integer :: len_str2 = len_trim(str2)

    ! Process second program's logic
    a1 =0
    a2 =0

    ! Process a_str
    a_str = str2
    do i=2, len_str2
        if (a_str(i:i) == a_str(i-1:i-1)) then
            if (a_str(i:i) == '1') then
                a_str(i:i) = '0'
            else
                a_str(i:i) = '1'
            end if
            a1 = a1 +1
        end if
    end do

    ! Process b_str
    b_str = str2
    do i = len_str2, 2, -1
        if (b_str(i:i) == b_str(i-1:i-1)) then
            if (b_str(i-1:i-1) == '1') then
                b_str(i-1:i-1) = '0'
            else
                b_str(i-1:i-1) = '1'
            end if
            a2 = a2 +1
        end if
    end do

    min_val = min(a1, a2)

    ! Process third program's logic
    newNumber =0
    pow =0
    temp_val = min_val

    do while (temp_val >0)
        r = mod(temp_val,10)
        temp_val = temp_val /10
        if (9 - r < r) then
            if ( (temp_val ==0) .and. (9 - r ==0) ) then
                digit = r
            else
                digit = 9 - r
            end if
        else
            digit = r
        end if
        newNumber = newNumber + digit * 10**pow
        pow = pow +1
    end do

    ! Output the final result
    print *, newNumber

    deallocate(inputs)

end program main
